reviewText: Could not view this on my Blu-ray player. Got a replacement and that one didn't work either, very disappointing since this is a great movie. Gave 3 stars for on-time delivery for both original and replacement shipments and price.
We had to return this because it would not play!  We got the replacement and that will not play either.  Disappointed.....
This movie is absolute garbage, don't waste your money

Will Ferrell is hit or miss for me, but this one was a hit right out of the park.

I barely remember the Sid and Marty Krofft's shows; I have just enough knowledge of the show to recognize names of people and things, and to get the handful of "inside" jokes, but that doesn't even matter. The movie holds it's own and it's very entertaining.

I mean, you have to turn off your brain of course, it's not a movie steeped in science or philosophy, but it'll make you laugh.
It's one of those movies you just have to check your brain at the entrance before you watch it. I'm a huge Will Ferrell fan and I thought it was really funny.
Great movie and DVD is in good shape.  Enjoyed the film.
Horrible i received a scratched case and to top it off the Blu-ray disc was missing!!!! Super disappointed as I've been looking for this movie for sometime :(
"This is one of those days when pouring piss on your head is a bad idea!"

Where in the world is Matt Lauer? Actually Mat is the greatest actor in the film; Mat plays himself and adds credibility to the story.

Even though this film follows the general lost world formula it is unique and does not try to copy those films that have come before it. Dr. Rick Marshall (Will Ferrell) has a parallel world theory that might supply us with the energy we need in this energy strapped world. This theory lands him a job as a La Brea Tar Pits science teacher. Enter cute freckle faced Holly Cantrell (Anna Friel) who shows proof that his theory is a reality. Together they venture in this world. Together they overcome great odds which include dinosaurs and skullduggery. Will they be able to return together?

The film is quite fun, tongue-in-cheek, and very handy; and watch where they place their handy's.
If you listen closely The Zarn (voice) is Leonard Nimoy from the movie "Them!"

I only saw the Blu-Ray version so I cannot compare media. However this is not just another tachyon film.
There are some voiceover extras including a food diary.
We've gotten 2 copies of this and neither work.
My Kids love this movie. Can't seem to find it in stores, so I was happy to find it here for cheap!
